definition: Song Renqiong (1909-2005), general of the People's Liberation Army
surname Song/the Song dynasty (960-1279)/also Song of the Southern dynasties 南朝宋 (420-479)
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)
poor/destitute/to use up/to exhaust/thoroughly/extremely/(coll.) persistently and pointlessly
Li Xiannian (1909-1992), PRC general and politician
Yang Shangkun (1907-1998), former president of PRC and military leader
Chen Zaidao (1909-1993), general in the People's Liberation Army
Tan Zhenlin (1902-1983), PRC revolutionary and military leader, played political role after the Cultural Revolution
Zhu De (1886-1976), communist leader and founder of the People's Liberation Army

Peng Dehuai (1898-1974), top communist general, subsequently politician and politburo member, disgraced after attacking Mao's failed policies in 1959, and died after extensive persecution during the Cultural Revolution
Liu Shaoqi (1898-1969), Chinese communist leader, a martyr of the Cultural Revolution
He Long (1896-1969), important communist military leader, died from persecution during the Cultural Revolution
Luo Ronghuan (1902-1963), Chinese communist military leader
Chen Yi (1901-1972), communist general and politician, Marshal of PLA from 1955, Mayor of Shanghai in 1950s, PRC foreign minister 1958-1972
Hu Yaobang (1915-1989), Chinese politician
Li Fuchun (1900-1975), communist politician
Bo Yibo (1908-2007), ranking PRC politician, served on State Council from 1950s to 1980s as colleague of Deng Xiaoping
Chi Haotian (1929-), Chinese Minister of National Defense 1993-2003
Wang Zhen (1908-1993), Chinese political figure
Zhou Enlai (1898-1976), Chinese communist leader, prime minister 1949-1976
